history.content:
I think as long as your major is declared before phase2 ends, you will still get priority.

-----

I was declared this semester about 1 week before adjustment period started, and I was part of the earliest batch. I would advise you to consider signing up for classes in phase II which traditionally have been easier to get into (e.g. 170, 188) and pay close attention to the opening of new sections, or take something such as 61C which is friendlier towards non-majors.
I think as long as your major is declared before phase2 ends, you will still get priority.

children.subject:
The timeline for Spring and Fall declarations are different, due to the different amounts of time between the semesters. Students who declare in the spring have their majors in the system relatively early (since Phase I doesn't end until mid-July) compared to students who declare in the fall.

For spring declaration, see @1545.
Okay thank you! Do you have any insight on how long the process will take, from the end of the semester to officially being declared?

history.content: Based on the deadline and when grades are official, I would expect CS declaration to be done roughly around mid-June. So priority would likely be available for Phase II. If you're already declared in another major, this takes much longer dues to double major packet and other departments processing.

I'm taking CS70 and 61B right now, and plan on declaring the major ASAP after the semester ends. Will I be able to do that in time to get priority for upper div CS classes? I don't want to get stuck being done with all the pre-reqs but unable to take any more advanced classes
history.subject: Getting into upper divs the semester after declaring?
